titleStmt.title: Postcards from the Southern Cone: a DCHM project

sourceDesc.bibl: A collection of twenty postcards from Argentina and Uruguay, between 1900 and 1910.

projectDesc.p: Here we can write a project descrition that will go in the home page?

figure.label: Postcard to Conrrada E. Abreu - Front
figure.figDesc: An image of a woman posing and typewritten message.

figure.label: Postcard to Conrrada E. Abreu - Back
figure.figDesc: The back of a postcard with the recipient's information

div.p:
Mi aspiracionaspiración masmás grangran-
de y mi deceodeseo mas ardiente son
que el año que hoy empieza sea
el precursor de tu masmás complecomple-
ta felicidad y gratas satifa
cionessatisfac-
ciones.

My biggest aspiration
and my most fervent wish are
that the year that today begins
brings you the utmost happiness
and great satisfaction.

div.ab:
Señorita
Conrrada E Abreu
Piedad 8 Ciudad

Miss
Conrrada E Abreu
Piedad 8 Ciudad

figure.label: Postcard to Clementina Ghione - Front
figure.figDesc: An image of an old rural cottage in a golden frame; color and relief; handwritten text.

figure.label: Postcard to Clementina Ghione - Back
figure.figDesc: Handwritten text: recipient and address; a stamp fragment.

div.p:
que podria¿qué podría yo desearte en
Este diaeste día? PuePues lo unicoúnico es un millonmillón
Dede felicidades para tu porvenir.

what could I wish
for you on this day? Only a million
blessings for your future.

div.ab:
Sta Clementina Ghione
JuánJuan M Blanes N° 37
Ciudad

Miss Clementina Ghione
Juan M Blanes N°37
Ciudad

correspAction.persName: Unknown person identified as Distinguido corresponsal

figure.label: Postcard to Distinguido corresponsal (1) - Front
figure.figDesc: An image of a plant; color and relief; handrwitten text; one stamp.

figure.label: Postcard to Distinguido corresponsal (1) - Back
figure.figDesc: Handwritten text and sender's signature.

div.p:
Lo más delicioso en una flor
es su perfume Yperfume. Y en una mujer
la dulsuradulzura de su caráctercarácter.

What is most delicious in a flower
is its perfume and in a woman
the sweetness of her character.

Acabo de recibir su linda postal lo que lala que
contesto inmediatamente – ce. Contestaré áa
su pregunta – si: sí, he recibido la
última postal de la colección – lo, por la
que creo haberle dado las gracias
en mis anteriores – ds. De Buenos Aires me
la remitieron enseguida áa estaesta.
Le pido me disculpe por queporque no
le mando belleza – a, pues no he
podido encontrar en ninguna parte
pero he mandado áa pedir áa la
ciudad y en cuando venga le
mandaré –é.

closer.salute:
Sin más lo saluda
afectuosamente su corresponsall,

div.p:
I just received your pleasant postcard
to which I’ll reply immediately.
I’ll answer your question:
yes, I received the last postcard
of the collection, and I think
I thanked you for that in my previous
postcard. It was forwarded right away
from Buenos Aires to this address.
I beg you’ll excuse me for not sending
you beauty, but I couldn’t find
one anywhere. However, I ordered
one from the city and when it
arrives, I’ll send it to you.

closer.salute:
Without further ado, most affectionately,
Your correspondent,

correspAction.persName: Unknown person identified as Distinguido corresponsal

figure.label: Postcard to Distinguido corresponsal - Front
figure.figDesc: A red 1906 seal and a rosehip branches against a golden background; (metallic) color and relief; handwritten text; one stamp.

figure.label: Postcard to Distinguido corresponsal - Back
figure.figDesc: Handwritten text and sender's signature.

div.p:
Feliz año nuevo le desea su
corresponsal y amigaa.

Happy New Year from
your correspondent and friend.

Distinguido Corresponsal: -hehe recibido
su dos lindas postales la que lepor las que estoy
muy agradecida, pues me agradan
mucho las colecciones –s. Estoy otra
vez en Roque Pérez –z pues he tenido
que venir antes de lo que pensaba
por excusa de q’que mi hermanita
se encontraba bastante grave – asie. Así
que me dirijadiríjame otra vez acá la
correspondenciaa.

¿Quiere decirme quequé clase de tar-
jetas prefiere? asiAsí yo le puedo
enviar eh? Quisiera que en este
año que empezamos vea realizados
todos sus deseos sons. Son los votos q’que
hace su corresponsal y amiga

Dear Correspondent, I’ve received
your two beautiful postcards, which
I’m thankful for as I really like
the collections. I’m once again in
Roque Pérez. I had to come earlier
than I expected because my little
sister was in quite a serious
condition. So send the correspondence
here again.

Would you like to tell me what
kind of cards you prefer? So I can
send you one, huh? I hope that in
the year that now begins you will see
all your wishes come true. These
are the prayers said by your
correspondent and friend.

correspAction.persName: Unknown person identified as Distinguido corresponsal

figure.label: Postcard to Distinguido corresponsal (3) - Front
figure.figDesc: An image of a flower basket; color; handwritten text; one stamp.

figure.label: Postcard to Distinguido corresponsal (3) - Back
figure.figDesc: Handwritten text.

div.p:
yo le dirediré que en esa fotografiafotografía no estoy nada
bien – soy mucho mejor – mr. Muchas gracias por
su amabilidad – d, no creiacreía que Ud. seriasería
tan amable con un niña -a. ¿No piensa man-
darme el suyo? Sin embargo me lo prome-
tio –ó y lo ”prometido es deuda”, no¿no es
asiasí?
div.closer:
Esperando su próxima lo saluda
su corresponsall,
Micaela Leoner Sierra
Roque Pérez

div.p:
I’ll tell you that in that picture
I don’t look great, I’m much better.
Thank you for your kindness. I
never thought you’d be so nice to
a girl. Aren’t you going to send me
your portrait? You promised this,
and “a promise is a promise”, isn’t it?
div.closer:
Looking forward to hearing from you.
Your correspondent,
Micaela Leoner Sierra
Roque Pérez

div.p:
He recibido
cuatro postales de la colección que
me está mandando – es muy boni-
ta – gracias – ls. Le diré que no pude
contestar áa su lindas postales
por que me encontraba lejos
de este pueblo –o, en una Estancia
de una amiguita – ya. Y como no pude
venir áa esta –a, ¿no sabía que Ud
me había mandando – por quequé me las
manda áa [lugar]? no¿No sabe que estoy
otra vez en R. Perez? Sin embargo le
mandé ha decir –r, así que le pido
me disculpe no haya contestado a sus
tarjetas –s. Una amiguita miamía le ha
gustado mucho sussu pos caligrafiacaligrafía
y me ha pedido que le haga firmar
esa postal que le adjunto - o, ¿quiere
hacerme ese favor? Se los agradeceria –agradecería.
Me dice Ud. en una postal que no
creiacreía que yo era tan linda –a. Sin embargo

I have received
four postcards from the collection that
you are sending me. It is very nice,
thank you. I will tell you that I could not
reply to your pretty postcards because
I was far away from this town, at a friend’s
ranch - and since I could not come here,
I did not know that you had sent them to me.
Why are you sending them to [place]? Don't you know
that I am again in R. Perez? However, I sent
you word of this. So I beg your pardon and
apologize for not answering your cards.
A little friend of mine liked your calligraphy
very much and asked me to have you sign the
enclosed postcard. Would you do me that favor?
I would appreciate it. You tell me on a
postcard that you didn't think I was so pretty. However

figure.label: Postcard to Ernesto Musetti (1) - Front
figure.figDesc: A rural landscape, including two horses and a farmer; color; handwritten text; two stamps.

figure.label: Postcard to Ernesto Musetti (1) - Back
figure.figDesc: Handwritten text: recipient and address.

figure.label: Postcard to Ernesto Musetti (2) - Front
figure.figDesc: Maritime motif, sailboats in the horizon; (metallic) colors and relief; handwritten text; one stamp.

figure.label: Postcard to Ernesto Musetti (2) - Back
figure.figDesc: Handwritten text: recipient and address.

lg.l: Como una vela en el mar.
Like a sail on the sea.

figure.label: Postcard to Ernesto Musetti (3) - Front
figure.figDesc: Coastal landscape: Torquay Natural Arch; color; handwritten text; one stamp.

figure.label: Postcard to Ernesto Musetti (3) - Back
figure.figDesc: Handwritten text: recipient and address.

div.p: La naturaleza se vanagloria al contemplar sus inimitables obras y se manifiesta orgullosa con los artistas, puesto que ninguno de ellos llegará jamás a igualarla. E Musetti Marzo 1906
Nature boasts when contemplating her inimitable work and displays herself proudly to the artists, as none of them will ever match her E Musetti March 1906
Señor Ernesto Musetti Cerrito 138 Bs Aires
Mister Ernesto Musetti Cerrito 138 Bs Aires

figure.label: Postcard to Ernesto Musetti (4) - Front
figure.figDesc: Maritime motif, ships in the ocean; color; handwritten text; one stamp.

figure.label: Postcarrd to Ernesto Musetti (4)
figure.figDesc: Handwritten text: recipient and address.

div.p: El hombre se balancea en las ilusiones de la vida como la frágil barquilla sobre las olas del mar. Su corresponsal Claudina Monlezun Noviembre 24, 1904
Man balances himself on the illusions of life like a fragile sailboat on the sea waves. Yours, Claudina Monlezun November 24, 1904
Señor Ernesto Musetti Buenos. Aires
Mister Ernesto Musetti Buenos Aires

figure.label: Postcard to María Quintela (1) - Front
figure.figDesc: Two flowers, one with the face of a child (pasted); color (hand-coloring) and relief; handwritten text.

figure.label: Postcard to María Quintela (1) - Back
figure.figDesc: Handwritten text: recipient and address.

div.p:
Maria Quien te saluda y hase votos por tu felicidad y dicha es esta amiga que mucho te quiere. !Adiós! Julia Menchaca
Treinta y Tres 12 = 16 – 1906

Maria, The one who greets you And prays for your happiness Is this friend of yours That loves you dearly. Adieu! Julia Menchaca
Treinta y Tres 12=16-1906
Señorita Maria Quintela Olimar
Miss Maria Quintela Olimar

figure.label: Postcard to María Quintela (2) - Front
figure.figDesc: A girl hugging a cat; color (hand-coloring); handwritten text.

figure.label: Postcard to María Quintela (2) - Back
figure.figDesc: Handwritten text: recipient.

div.p:
33” 4 – 10 – 1907
Como estrecha esta preciosa niña su gatito quiciera te- ner la dicha de estrechar- te a ti mi Maruja que- rida, entre mis brazos.
Esperamoste pronto. Tu prima Josefita

Like this beautiful girl hugs her kitten, I’d love to have the pleasure of hugging you, my dear Maruja, between my arms.
We are looking forward to seeing you soon, Your cousin, Josefita
Sta Maruja J Quintela
Miss Maruja J. Quintela

figure.label: Postcard to María Quintela (3) - Front
figure.figDesc: A bride and a groom looking at each other; sepia; handwritten and printed text.

figure.label: Postcard to María Quintela (3) - Back
figure.figDesc: Handwritten text: recipient and address.

div.p:
“33 11 – 13 de 1907
Deseo que tu como la figura que presenta esta postal ten- gas quién te diga lo mismo que en esta Diosma Silvera
*Printed text: Para mi que momento encantador, leo en tus ojos el mas ardiente amor*

“33 11 – 13 of 1907
I wish for you to have someone to tell you the same words as the person in this postcard Diosma Silvera
*Printed text: such a lovely moment for me, to see in your eyes the most ardent love.
Señorita Maria Quintela Treinta y Tres
Miss Maria Quintela Treinta y Tres

figure.label: Postcard to María Quintela (4) - Front
figure.figDesc: A couple leaning on a fence; color (hand-coloring); handwritten text.

figure.label: Postcard to María Quintela (4) - Back
figure.figDesc: Handwritten text: message, recipient and address.

div.p: En tanto que el amor dura Toda locura es fineza Luego que olvido empieza Toda fineza es locura – 12.28.1909
As long as love lasts Every folly is a compliment When love is forgotten Every compliment is a folly 12.28.1909

Que el año que se inicia sea para tí, portador de la dicha y felicidad que te desea quien bien te quiere Julia Margarita
Señorita Maria J. Quintela Olimar Grande

May the year that begins Be for you the bearer Of the joy and happiness That those who love you Wish upon you
Miss Maria J. Quintela Olimar Grande

figure.label: Postcard to María Saint Hilaire - Front
figure.figDesc: A man offering flowers to a woman; color (hand-coloring); handwritten text; part of a stamp.

figure.label: Postcard to MAría Saint Hilaire - Back
figure.figDesc: Handwritten text: recipient and address; part of a stamp.

div.p: ¿Que es la vida sin amor? Lo que una pena sin llanto Un ruiseñor sin canto Y sin perfume una flor Clotilde Octubre 8/904
What is life without love? It is sadness without tears A nightingale without a song And without perfume a flower Clotilde October 8/904

Impreso
Señorita Maria Saint Hilaire 18 de Julio 503 Capital

Printed
Miss Maria Saint Hilaire 18 de Julio 503 Capital

figure.label: Postcard to Manuela J. Vinent - Front
figure.figDesc: A picture of two children holding a flower basket; color (hand-coloring); handwritten and printed text.

figure.label: Postcard to Manuela Vinent - Back
figure.figDesc: Handwritten text: message, recipient and address.

div.p:
2-16-1906
En lo más re- cóndito de mi corazon guar- do su grata amistad. Diamante
In the deepest recesses of my heart I keep our lovely friendship Diamante

Agradecemos y retribuimos afec- tuosos saludos Suya Diamante
Sta Manuela J. Vinent Fray Marcos
We thank you and return our affectionate greetings Yours, Diamante

titleStmt.title: Postcard to Petrona C. de Quincoces (1)

figure.label: Postcard to Petrona C. de Quincoces (1) - Front
figure.figDesc: A woman with flowers in her hair and a bowl of fruit; sepia and colored glitter; handwritten text; one stamp.

figure.label: Postcard to Petrona C. de Quincoces (1) - Back
figure.figDesc: Handwritten text: recipient and address.

div.p:
Queridisima hija Hoy en tu dia elevo fervientes votos al Todopoderoso para que sus designios hacia ti sean de imperdurable dicha y te colme de salud y vienestar por infinitos años
Josefa M de [C?] Octubre 5 de 1094

My dear daughter, Today on your day I pray to the Almighty that his designs for you are of eternal happiness and that he grants you health and well-being for endless years. Josefa M de C. October 5 of 1094
Señora Petrona C de Quincoces Rivera 50 C V
Mrs. Petrona C de Quincoces Rivera 50 C V

titleStmt.title: Postcard to Petrona C. de Quincoces (2)

figure.label: Postcard to Petrona P. de Quincoces (2) - Front
figure.figDesc: Flowers; color; handwritten text.

figure.label: Postcard to Petrona C. de Quincoces (2) - Back
figure.figDesc: Handwritten text: recipient and address; two stamps.

div.p: La virtud y la modestia realza la belleza de la mujer. Tu ahijada Carolina Montevideo 10 – 6/904
Virtue and modesty enhance a woman’s beauty. Your goddaughter Carolina Montevideo 10 – 6/904
Sra Petrona C. de Quincoces Calle Rivera N°50 Ciudad
Mrs. Petrona C. de Quincoces Calle Rivera N°50 Ciudad

titleStmt.title: Postcard to Petrona C. de Quincoces (3)

figure.label: Postcard to Petrona C. de Quincoces (3) - Front
figure.figDesc: Flowers in the foreground and sailboats in the sea in the background; color (hand-coloring) and relief; handwritten text.

figure.label: Postcard to Petrona C. de Quincoces (3) - Back
figure.figDesc: Handwritten text: message, recipient and address; two stamps.

div.p:
1 – 1 – 1.908
Crescencia Tassano
1 – 1- 1.908 Crescencia Tassano

Que Dios envie á la tierra un sinnumeros de felicidades para su muy querida y apreciable existencia son los mas vivos deseos de su ahijada la que la besa y abr aza con efucion Crescencia
Señora Petrona C de Quincoces Calle Rivera Chica N°50 Montevideo

May God send to Earth countless blessings For your very dear and estimable Existence. These are the most heartfelt Wishes of your goddaughter, who sends you warm kisses And hugs. Crescencia
Mrs. Petrona C. de Quincoces Calle RiveraN°50 Montevideo

figure.label: Postcard to Paula Grand - Front
figure.figDesc: A dove carrying a letter (pasted) and blue flowers; color and relief; handwritten and printed text.

figure.label: Postcard to Paula Grand - Back
figure.figDesc: Handwritten text: recipient and address; one stamp.

div.p:
Enero 1 De 1907
Muchas *Felicidades* te desea en el dia de hoy tu amiga Rosa Luraschi

January 1 1907
Your friend congratulates On this day Rosa Luraschi
Sta Paula Grand Ciudad
Miss Paula Grand Ciudad

correspAction.placeName: Avenida de la Paz, Montevideo, Uruguay

figure.label: Postcard to Vicente Magallanes - Front
figure.figDesc: Victor Hugo themed postcard: his portrait and house; color; handwritten text; part of a stamp.

figure.label: Postcard to Vicente Magallanes - Back
figure.figDesc: Handwritten text: recipient and address; one stamp and part of another stamp.

div.p: Victor Hugo fué un gigante de aquellos que él mismo clasifi có de hombres océanos. después de haberlo contemplado todo hombre tiene que confesar que no hay tempestades mas grandiosas que las que agitan sus ondas ni tintas mas dulces que las que ostenta su superficie en las horas fugaces de la calma. José Salgado

Victor Hugo was one of those giants t hat he himself called Ocean-man. After having contemplated the ocean, every man must confess that there are no storms more majestic than those that agitate its waves, nor inks sweeter than those reflected on its surface in the fleeting hours of calm. José Salgado
Sr *M*ayor Vicente Magallanes Avenida de la Paz entre Río Negro y O. del Plata (B. 13 de G. Nacionales) Ciudad
Mr. *M*ajor Vicente Magallanes Avenida de la Paz between Río Negro and O. del Plata (B. 13 de G. Nacionales) Ciudad
